definition: to force someone to do something
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But this is obviously an outrageous demand given China's stable development strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这在中国追求稳定发展之际无疑是强人所难，此其一。

sentences.english: Thus we become greedy, stingy, and inconsiderate.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我们变得贪婪，吝啬，和强人所难。

sentences.english: He knew what he wanted to say, but the actual articulation was difficult for him.
sentences.chinese: 英语准确的音节对于他来说是有些强人所难。

sentences.english: I regard it as an imposition.

definition: to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
